subject: Design
title: Child-Proof Caps: Designing Against the User
description: A short lesson to help you apply Child-Proof Caps: Designing Against the User.

hook.text: Child-proof caps are intentionally hard to open. It's the only product designed to frustrate its user.

buildup.text: Before 1970, accidental child poisoning from medicine was a leading cause of emergency room visits.

discovery.text: Push-and-turn caps exploit the fact that children under 5 can't perform two simultaneous motions.

twist.text: The caps also frustrate elderly users with arthritis â€” the people who need medicine most.

climax.text: Safety design often creates tension between protecting one group and inconveniencing another.

punchline.text: A cap designed to frustrate adults saves 100+ children per year.

quiz.question: What cognitive limitation do child-proof caps exploit?
options: Young children can't perform two motions simultaneously
